com.jrfom.gw2

Class ApiClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.http.client.support.HttpAccessor
      • org.springframework.http.client.support.InterceptingHttpAccessor
        • org.springframework.web.client.RestTemplate
          • com.jrfom.gw2.ApiClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RestOperations

    @Component
public class ApiClient
extends RestTemplate

    Provides a simple interface for interacting with the public Guild Wars 2 API. Whenever possible, methods of this interface will return simple objects. However, if there is a possibility for an error being returned by the remote API, then the resulting object of this client's method will be wrapped in an Optional. In all such cases, an instance of GwApiError will be thrown. This error can either be ignored, or it can be trapped with a try...catch construct.

    You can either instantiate this class directly, or use the getInstance() method to retrieve a static instance.

        public ColorsList getColors(String lang)
        Retrieve the list of colors localized to the specified language. See API:1/colors for more information.
        Parameters:
        lang - A valid language abbreviation. For example, "en" for English or "de" for German. An invalid abbreviation will equate to using "en".
        Returns:
        An instance of ColorsList.

      • getEventDetails

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<EventDetails> getEventDetails()
        Retrieve the full list of events and their details localized to the English language. This will be a slow process. See getEventDetailsForEventId(String) for a better method to use.
        Returns:
        An instance of EventDetails wrapped in an Optional. If there was an error, then the Optional will be empty. In this case, a GwApiError will be thrown. You can trap that exception if you need more details.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getEventDetailsForEventId

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<EventDetails> getEventDetailsForEventId(String eventId)
        Retrieve the details for a given event identifier. A list of identifiers can be retrieved via getEventNames(). The details will be localized to the English language. For a different localization use getEventDetailsForEventIdInLang(String, String).
        Parameters:
        eventId - The event identifier to lookup.
        Returns:
        An instance of EventDetails wrapped in an Optional. If there was an error, then the Optional will be empty. In this case, a GwApiError will be thrown. You can trap that exception if you need more details.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getEventDetailsForEventIdInLang

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<EventDetails> getEventDetailsForEventIdInLang(String eventId,
                                                                            String lang)
        Retrieve a list of event details as described in API:1/event_details. If no eventId is given, a full list of event details will be retrieved -- this will be slow.
        Parameters:
        eventId - A valid event identifier. See getEventNamesForLang(String) for a way to get a list of valid identifiers.
        lang - A valid language abbreviation. For example, "en" for English or "de" for German. An invalid abbreviation will equate to using "en".
        Returns:
        An instance of EventDetails wrapped in an Optional. If there was an error, then the Optional will be empty. In this case, a GwApiError will be thrown. You can trap that exception if you need more details.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getEventNames

        public EventNamesList getEventNames()
        Retrieve a list of event names localized to the English language.
        Returns:
        An instance of EventNamesList.

      • getEventNamesForLang

        public EventNamesList getEventNamesForLang(String lang)
        Retrieve a list of event names localized to the given language abbreviation. If no abbreviation is given (i.e. null), or the abbreviation is invalid, then the names will be localized to English ("en").
        Parameters:
        lang - A valid language abbreviation. For example, "en" for English or "de" for German. An invalid abbreviation will equate to using "en".
        Returns:
        An instance of EventNamesList.

      • getEventStatuses

        public WorldEventsStatusList getEventStatuses()

        Retrieve a list of event statuses. See getEventStatusesForWorldAndMapAndEvent(int, int, String) for full details.

        Important: this method literally returns all possible event statuses across all game worlds and game maps. It is extremely unlikely that you want this, and it is a very slow process. You should really use one of the narrower methods for getting event statuses.

        Returns:
        A list of all possible statuses.

      • getEventStatusesForWorld

        public WorldEventsStatusList getEventStatusesForWorld(int worldId)

        Retrieve a list of event statuses. See getEventStatusesForWorldAndMapAndEvent(int, int, String) for full details.

        The result of this method will be a list that is constrained to only one world. It will be all events for that world across all game maps.

        Parameters:
        worldId - A valid world id or -1 for all worlds.
        Returns:
        Either a list of statuses or an empty list.

      • getEventStatusesForMap

        public WorldEventsStatusList getEventStatusesForMap(int mapId)

        Retrieve a list of event statuses. See getEventStatusesForWorldAndMapAndEvent(int, int, String) for full details.

        The result of this method will be list that is constrained to only a certain game map. The list will consists of all events in that map for all game worlds.

        Parameters:
        mapId - A valid map id or -1 for all maps.
        Returns:
        Either a list of statuses or an empty list.

      • getEventStatusesForWorldAndMap

        public WorldEventsStatusList getEventStatusesForWorldAndMap(int worldId,
                                                   int mapId)

        Retrieve a list of event statuses. See getEventStatusesForWorldAndMapAndEvent(int, int, String) for full details.

        The result of this method will be a list that is constrained to a specific map on a specific world. Thus, this should be a fast response.

        Parameters:
        worldId - A valid world id or -1 for all worlds.
        mapId - A valid map id or -1 for all maps.
        Returns:
        Either a list of statuses or an empty list.

      • getEventStatusesForEvent

        public WorldEventsStatusList getEventStatusesForEvent(String eventId)

        Retrieve a list of event statuses. See getEventStatusesForWorldAndMapAndEvent(int, int, String) for full details.

        The result of this method will be a list of event statuses for a single event across all game worlds and, potentially, all game maps.

        Parameters:
        eventId - A valid event identifier. See getEventNamesForLang(String) for a way to get a list of valid identifiers.
        Returns:
        A list of statuses for the given eventId or a list of all possible event statuses if the eventId is invalid. Hint: use a valid event identifier. You don't want the full list.

      • getEventStatusesForWorldAndEvent

        public WorldEventsStatusList getEventStatusesForWorldAndEvent(int worldId,
                                                     String eventId)

        Retrieve a list of event statuses. See getEventStatusesForWorldAndMapAndEvent(int, int, String) for full details.

        The result of this method will be a list that is constrained to a specific game world, but will contain all events with the given event identifier.

        Parameters:
        worldId - A valid world id or -1 for all worlds.
        eventId - A valid event identifier. See getEventNamesForLang(String) for a way to get a list of valid identifiers.
        Returns:
        Either a list of statuses or an empty list.

      • getEventStatusesForMapAndEvent

        public WorldEventsStatusList getEventStatusesForMapAndEvent(int mapId,
                                                   String eventId)

        Retrieve a list of event statuses. See getEventStatusesForWorldAndMapAndEvent(int, int, String) for full details.

        The result of this method will be list of event statuses that are constrained to a specific game map but across all game worlds.

        Parameters:
        mapId - A valid map id or -1 for all maps.
        eventId - A valid event identifier. See getEventNamesForLang(String) for a way to get a list of valid identifiers.
        Returns:
        Either a list of statuses or an empty list.

      • getEventStatusesForWorldAndMapAndEvent

        public WorldEventsStatusList getEventStatusesForWorldAndMapAndEvent(int worldId,
                                                           int mapId,
                                                           String eventId)

        Retrieve a list of event statuses from /v1/events. This list can be filtered by any combination of the method parameters.

        Note: if you give any parameter that is invalid, no error will be returned by the remote API. If either the worldId or mapId are incorrect then an empty list will be returned. If the only invalid parameter is the eventId then it will be ignore. If the only given parameter is the eventId, that is worldId and mapId are -1, then the whole list of events for every world and map will be retrieved.

        Parameters:
        worldId - A valid world id or -1 for all worlds.
        mapId - A valid map id or -1 for all maps.
        eventId - A valid event identifier. See getEventNamesForLang(String) for a way to get a list of valid identifiers.
        Returns:
        Either a list of statuses or an empty list.

      • getGuildDetailsForGuildId

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<Guild> getGuildDetailsForGuildId(String guildId)

        Retrieves details for a guild with the specified guildId.

        If the id you supply cannot be found, the remote service will return an error object. Thus, a GwApiError will be thrown. You can trap that error if you would like more details. Otherwise, simply check for the presence of a value in this method's result.

        Parameters:
        guildId - The UUID for the guild to lookup.
        Returns:
        An instance of Guild wrapped in an Optional on success. On failure, the Optional will be empty.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getGuildDetailsForGuildName

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<Guild> getGuildDetailsForGuildName(String name)

        Retrieves details for a guild with the specified name. If the name includes spaces, do not URI encode them. This method will take care of encoding for you.

        If the name you supply cannot be found, the remote service will return an error object. Thus, a GwApiError will be thrown. You can trap that error if you would like more details. Otherwise, simply check for the presence of a value in this method's result.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the guild to lookup.
        Returns:
        An instance of Guild wrapped in an Optional on success. On failure, the Optional will be empty.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getItems

        public ItemIdList getItems()

        Retrieves a list of all known item identifiers. Your application should probably cache this result for some amount of time.

        See /v1/items for more details.

        Returns:
        An instance of ItemIdList.

      • getItemDetails

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<Item> getItemDetails(int itemId)
        Retrieves details for a specified item localized to the English language. See getItemDetailsInLang(int, String) for more information.
        Parameters:
        itemId - A valid game item identifier.
        Returns:
        An instance of Item wrapped in an Optional if successful, otherwise an empty Optional.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getItemDetailsInLang

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<Item> getItemDetailsInLang(int itemId,
                                                         String lang)

        Retrieves details for a specified item localized to the specified language. If the given language identifier is invalid, the English language will be used. Possible language identifiers are:

        • "en" for English
        • "de" for German
        • "es" for Spanish
        • "fr" for French

        The result of this method will be wrapped in an Optional. If an invalid item identifier is given, then this Optional will be empty and a GwApiError will be thrown (trap it for more details). Otherwise, the Optional will contain an instance of Item. Possible types for Item are:

        • ArmorItem
        • BagItem
        • ConsumableItem
        • ContainerItem
        • CraftingMaterialItem
        • GizmoItem
        • MiniPetItem
        • TrinketItem
        • TrophyItem
        • UpgradeComponentItem
        • WeaponItem
        Parameters:
        itemId - A valid game item identifier.
        lang - A valid language abbreviation. For example, "en" for English or "de" for German. An invalid abbreviation will equate to using "en".
        Returns:
        An instance of Item wrapped in an Optional if successful, otherwise an empty Optional.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getMap

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<Map> getMap(int mapId)

        Retrieve the details for a given mapId localized to the English language. See getMapInLang(int, String) for more detail.

        Parameters:
        mapId - A valid map id.
        Returns:
        An instance of Map wrapped in an Optional or an empty Optional.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getMapInLang

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<Map> getMapInLang(int mapId,
                                                String lang)

        Retrieve the details for a given mapId localized to the specified lang.

        If the mapId is invalid then an instance of GwApiError will be thrown and an empty Optional will be returned.

        If an invalid lang is given, then the default language of English ("en") will be used instead.

        Parameters:
        mapId - A valid map id.
        lang - A valid language abbreviation. For example, "en" for English or "de" for German. An invalid abbreviation will equate to using "en".
        Returns:
        An instance of Map wrapped in an Optional or an empty Optional.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getMaps

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<MapsList> getMaps()

        Returns:
        An instance of MapsList wrapped in an Optional or an empty Optional.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getMapsInLang

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<MapsList> getMapsInLang(String lang)

        Retrieve the complete list of maps localized to the specified language. See getMapsInLang(int, String) for more detail.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        An instance of MapsList wrapped in an Optional or an empty Optional.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getMapsInLang

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<MapsList> getMapsInLang(int mapId,
                                                      String lang)

        Retrieves a list of maps for the specified mapId and localized to the specified lang. In theory, if you supply a then you should get back a list with only one element. So, to retrieve a list of all maps, supply a set to -1.

        If the is invalid, a GwApiError will be thrown and an empty Optional will be returned.

        If the specified lang is invalid, then the default language of English ("en") will be used.

        Parameters:
        mapId - A valid map id or -1 for all maps.
        lang - A valid language abbreviation. For example, "en" for English or "de" for German. An invalid abbreviation will equate to using "en".
        Returns:
        An instance of MapsList wrapped in an Optional or an empty Optional.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getFloorInLang

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<Floor> getFloorInLang(int continentId,
                                                    int floorId,
                                                    String lang)

        Retrieve details about a map floor given the appropriate continentId, floorId, and lang. The given lang will localize all strings to said language.

        Parameters:
        continentId - A valid Continent identifier.
        floorId - A valid Floor identifier.
        lang - A valid language abbreviation. For example, "en" for English or "de" for German. An invalid abbreviation will equate to using "en".
        Returns:
        An instance of Floor wrapped in an Optional or an empty Optional. The empty Optional will be returned when either an invalid continentId or floorId is given. This method will not throw an instance of GwApiError in such instances. This is because the remote ArenaNet API does not generate an error in this case.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getRecipes

        public RecipesList getRecipes()
        Retrieve the list of Recipe identifiers.
        Returns:
        An instance of RecipesList.

      • getRecipe

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<Recipe> getRecipe(int recipeId)
        Retrieve details for a specific recipe localized to the English language. See getRecipeInLang(int, String) for more details.
        Parameters:
        recipeId - A valid recipe identifier.
        Returns:
        An instance of Recipe wrapped in an Optional or an empty Optional. If an empty Optional was returned, an instance of GwApiError was also thrown.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getRecipeInLang

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<Recipe> getRecipeInLang(int recipeId,
                                                      String lang)

        Retrieve details about a specific recipe identified by recipeId. The details will be localized to the specified lang. If an invalid recipeId is given, a GwApiError will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        recipeId - A valid recipe identifier.
        lang - A valid language abbreviation. For example, "en" for English or "de" for German. An invalid abbreviation will equate to using "en".
        Returns:
        An instance of Recipe wrapped in an Optional or an empty Optional. If an empty Optional was returned, an instance of GwApiError was also thrown.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getWorldNames

        public WorldNamesList getWorldNames()
        Retrieve a list of available game world (server) names localized to the English language.
        Returns:
        An instance of WorldNamesList.

        lang - A valid language abbreviation. For example, "en" for English or "de" for German. An invalid abbreviation will equate to using "en".
        Returns:
        An instance of WorldNamesList.

      • getMatchDetails

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<MatchDetails> getMatchDetails(String matchId)
        Retrieve details for a specific WvW matchId. The matchId can be determined by inspecting the results of getMatches().
        Parameters:
        matchId - A valid match identifier.
        Returns:
        An instance of MatchDetails wrapped in an Optional or an empty Optional if the matchId was invalid. If the matchId was invalid, an instance of GwApiError will haven been thrown.
        Throws:
        {@link - com.jrfom.gw2.api.model.GwApiError}

      • getFiles

        public Files getFiles()
        Retrieve a list of commonly requested game asset files. Each GameAssetFile has methods for retrieving a URL to the render service for that specific asset.
        Returns:
        An instance of Files.
